author: Cordane C.

description:
I enjoyed coming to Tope purely for the playlist. My roommate and I were hanging out along the boozy streets of North Beach and we stumbled upon Tope and was immediately infatuated with the bay area slaps, if you're from the bay or grew up here you'll know what I mean! Like when e-40 makes a surprise appearance at a concert or that amateur DJ-for-hire is bumpin Too $hort at a Dubs game. The music here transported me back to my nostalgic college days when all my friends were playing bay area rap and hip hop at house parties. Good timez!

Top is smaller than its nearby bar counterparts. It's fun nonetheless, depending on the crowd. Sometimes people get hyphy and other times they could use a big sized Redbull to perk them up.

My first time here there were two Spanish guys near us and as they were playing some Too $hort hits, they were getting all latin on us and acting as if it was salsa by swaying their hips in that latin motion. lol.

I'd come here again if I were in the mood for that kind of music. Sometimes they weave in one hit wonders or more pop-like songs too so there's a little somethin' for everyone.
author: Connie M.

description:
Chill little bar you can stop in for a quick drink before going somewhere else. Good place for a date or to bring a friend to have a conversation. 

When I went, it might have been too early in the night but it was pretty laid back.
author: Glydia C.

description: Love this place!! Kyle and Patrick are so attractive! I mean attentive! Nice ambience.  Good music!
author: miki p.

description: I usually have so much fun at this place but I need to share a really bad experience I had one night with the DJ. Everybody was dancing and having a good time, so I thought to myself, why not elevate the fun even more. So I then requested my favorite song, Heartbreak Warfare by John Mayer, to the DJ. Instead of saying thank you for the awesome suggestion and playing it immediately, he told me "he didn't have access to the song on his laptop". Not only are there amazing startups out there like YouTube and Spotify who provide a service for this exact need, it also really disturbed me that he didn't have a local download of Heartbreak Warfare on his laptop. Needless to say, the song was never played but I will probably still go back
author: Bradford W.

description:
Laid back little bar. Great place to grab a drink with a friend or a date. Went there on a Wed night around 9 pm and it wasn't crowded at all and just the right amount of noise where you can still carry on a real conversation without anyone hearing you or you hearing anyone else. 

Our bartender was also super cool. I will be back!
author: Song C.

description:
Fun place in north beach to go out. It was pretty packed on a Friday night. It's on a street with lots of bars so you can bar hop easily. 

They play some throw back music mixed with current jammers.
author: Alex M.

description: Fun place in the area for a night out! My friends and I stopped by after dinner and loved how low key the place is earlier in the evening. Great drinks and a great atmosphere. Will definitely come back again and stick around longer
author: Helen F.

author: Jul C.

description: Was in the area on business during the final game of the 2017 NBA finals looking for a place to watch the game. This fit the bill. Not too crazy or crowded, and Happy Hour until 10:00 PM. What!!? Yes, Happy Hour until 10:00 PM! That's $4.00 drinks! Can't beat this deal anywhere! Highly recommended and definitely return when in the area.
author: Efren S.

description:
Crystal, the bartender,  is best 

Will will definitely be back and bring friends. Cool vibe in the bar, cool neighborhood.
author: Mollie A.

description: Happy hour until 10pm? Now that's some happy news! I've frequented this bar many times and never had a bad experience. The bartenders are always friendly, quick to serve, and attentive. The drinks are cheap and satisfying. Tope...you dope!
author: Christina W.

description: This place is so much fun!! We go to Tope all the time and it's always a fun and exciting time. The crowd is great, bartenders are really friendly, all around a great time:)
author: Trishalee H.

description:
I always go to Tope first then head over to Tupelo.  

It's a small venue, but really chill and great when it's just the right amount of crowded.
author: Michelle T.

description: Great beer selection with a focus on craft and local brews. I visited right after a tap take over from Magnolia Brewery. The bartender was friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable. She knew a lot about the beers on tap and about the local brewing scene. It seemed like the patrons were pretty knowledgeable and friendly as well. Tope has a big projection screen playing movies and a lounge-like area in the back. The atmosphere is modern and the bar itself is clean cut.
author: Joseph T.

description:
Insanely generous happy hour and a small yet fantastic selection of draft brews

Why is beer cheaper here than in LA?  I love it
author: Michael R.

description: My favorite bar in San Francisco! Tope is clean, trendy and has really really good, cheap drinks. Casey, the owner, is one of the nicest guys ever. I started coming to Tope the second I turned to 21 (literally) and I've never stopped. It's super mellow during the week and earlier on in the evening, so you can get a drink at the bar and watch them make yummy drinks. Later in the evening things get busier and drunk people start dancing. However, service is still great. I came on a crowded Friday night for my Bachelorette Party and Casey still found the time to light some drink on fire and make me drink it - it was awesome. Tope has a special place in my heart and it's a must go-to in SF!
author: Dawn M.

description:
Inebriated. Drunk. Tipsy. Sloshed.

Gone. Done. Hammered. Three sheets to the wind.

I'll add tope to my vocabulary, it means to drink alcoholic liquor habitually and to excess.

Uh, yeah.  I ain't sayin nope to tope!  (coz I'm so dope?)  :p

* okaaay, the rhyming stops here *

Unlike other North Beach bars that embody the dive/sports bar theme, Tope does the exact opposite: funky wallpaper, local artwork, fresh juices, fruit compote and bitters grace the cocktail menu.  

There were only 5 cocktails on the menu and 2 were for vodka fans. (I'm looking out for my peeps!) I wanted to try the Eastwood, a whiskey based cocktail with orange marmalade. I mean, marmalade is supposed to stay in the breakfast category, right?! I was concerned with this drink being too sweet (since it's also made with carpano antica) and when I expressed my concern to the bartender, he just smiled and said, "oh no, it's not sweet at all!" I was sold. The Benedictine and the fresh grapefruit really helped to counteract the sweet components in this drink and Templeton Rye has that smooth, lingering finish which stood up to the marmalade. 

My friend's vodka based Fresh Prince had muddled cucumber and ginger beer. Can you say, oh so yummy on a warm day? 

So the cocktails are good but scenesters maybe disappointed, because there isn't any in here! but if you're looking to have a mellow happy hour catching up with your girlfriend surrounded by local clientele and the occasional tourist, this is your spot.  Also, happy hour lasts til 10pm which means $3 well drinks and beers on tap. 

How can you resist that? Really, you can't (and shouldn't) especially since Broadway's strip clubs are only 5 minutes away.
author: Janice C.

description: Justin made great drinks. A relaxing place with an eclectic atmosphere!
author: Brian L.

description:
Fun times here as usual....
No cover charge
Drinks are very affordable
This place get packed easily so be prepared to feel like sardines packed in a can. 
DJ is in the back by the right side
Bar on your left
Tables to stand around on the right
Great music
Mixed crowd

Fun times....
author: Claudine V.

description: Chill atmosphere, great happy hour and rad bartenders, a great spot along the san francisco bar hoping trail. First time there, and it definitely will not be the last!
author: Tre S.

description: I was here with friends around midnight on a Friday night and we actually had no problem getting a table at the back! It was a great place to have some drinks and dance. Also, it's within walking distance of all the other great bars in little Italy
author: Hayley H.

description:
Strong tasty cocktails, good deal of privacy (is usually kind of empty on a weekday afternoon/evening), and dimly lit with a cute interior.

This was our (now closed for business) startup's go-to when we were based at 222 Columbus Ave.

Our little team had many a conversation and lots of fuzzy memories about...... dealing with stuff that seemed super stealthy and important back then.
author: Asha S.

description:
Short Story:
A good place to go to mix it up for happy hour.

Long Story:
I came here on a Wednesday night for a match.com Stir event...yes, lol...I am reviewing a match.com event on Yelp!  The place was decently crowded and the drinks were plenty.  The place had an interesting feel to it...a bit like a dive bar.  The service was good...though it was not on one of their ordinary days so take it with a grain of salt.
author: Michael W.

description:
At this wonderful little watering hole in North Beach, the happiest of hours lasts until 10 pm. Since I'm old and that's basically as late as I go these days,* that means it's always happy at Tope. 

The bartender's friendly and chatty if you choose to be, and those $3 wells (the bourbon is my old friend, Old Crow) only serve to make you happier. Unless you're a depressed drunk, in which case shut up, you're ruining my buzz. 
___________

*Unless I have a reason to celebrate, like a promotion, a holiday, a Tuesday. You know.
author: Peter D.

description:
We were originally planning to head to a couple of other bars in the area until my colleague pointed out Tope.  I'd heard good things so we decided to have "a quick drink" there before moving on.  Here's what happened when we walked up to the bar:

Bartender:          "What are you drinking?"
Me:                       "Umm...not sure."
Bartender:          "What do you like?"
Me:                       "I like whiskey but I don't like sweet.  Or mint."
Girl at the Bar:    "Yeah, I don't really like mint either."
Bartender (to Girl at the Bar):  "You're drinking a f*$#ing mojito."

Aaaaannnndddd we pulled up a couple of seats.  We knew right away that this would be a place worth spending some time.  The bartender, who I later discovered was named Casey, made me his tasty twist on the manhattan for my first drink.  We ended up trying several other cocktails as well.  None of them off the menu, all of them specially concocted by Casey and all of them well balanced and delicious.  That guy knows his stuff.

The cocktails were awesome but the crowd made this place worth staying for.  Everyone we met was friendly, fun and pretty hilarious actually.  I was thinking that it would be great if I lived across the street, I'd be in every night.  Although, it's probably good that I don't live across the street.  This place has the magical ability to turn "one quick drink" into 4 or 5.  Besides, without the walk home, I wouldn't have the excuse to stop for a late night snack along the way!
author: Andrea H.

description:
It's so hard to find places that do not play house music lately. Tope played 90's hip hop! ILOVEYOUGUYS. Went 'bar hopping' after a birthday dinner but we loved this place so much that we ended staying here till closing. I still didnt want to leave.

We had about 5 rounds, we go HAM. (hard as a m'fer) Had shots of goose, jamie, fireball. Apparently mixing is a misconception? Tell that to my hangovers. But what I didn't hang on to... it was less than 8 dollar for shots, so 5 rounds is NO BIGS.

Bartenders were friendly and inviting. Dance floor was cute. We were able to get a table in the back at the booth area. 2 bathrooms with minimal wait. 

twas a perfect night. Thank you tope!
author: Wendy X.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place. Good location right in the heart of the North Beach bar scene. Decor is nice - in fact, it looks a bit more upscale than its surroundings. BUT the place gets sardine packed - think Polk street at its finest. It's a real issue because the place is typical San Francisco architecture, meaning long and narrow. So squeezing between the bar and 5 people deep behind it is about all you can do. Throw in some loud music and it makes mingling or even attempting to stand near all your friends pretty much impossible. 

I actually like this place and think it has real potential - but they need to do a bit more crowd control and not let so many people in at once!
author: Krista S.

description:
Great addition to N.Beach. Definitely classier than some of the surrounding spots and hence it attracts both couples and conversationalists. yet not remotely stuffy, still a true "bar" (as the name suggests).

So we'd like to thank them for being the last secret spot on our scavenger hunt bar crawl last night! (see pic). That's what victory looks like.... Go Team Yelptini!

Great night, but of all our secret spots, Tope was my favorite. Great shots btw (great thurs-weekend bartender  too!)
author: Mike V.

description:
Happy hour till 10pm makes you a winner. Too bad the night I went, our 49ers got trounced by the Seahawks. Ughhhh.

They're also cool with folks bringing in food so you can go to Golden Boy's first and get some pizza for your beer.
author: Misha T.

description:
2012 Drunkcathlon: San Fran Edition. Review #2

Drink requirement: Order 2 shots of "the worst gin available"

Tope, man. Every time I stop in to this place, I wish that I lived in San Francisco. Such great people working here. This was our last stop on our Drunkcathlon journey, and the pretty lady bartending was kind enough not only to provide us with our odd drink requirement with a smile, but also hooked us up with 7 glasses of water without giving us a "look" that a lot of bartenders will do. Simple perfection every time I come here. Thanks, Tope!
author: Kaity J.

description: Love the atmosphere (dark, rich) and music (hip hop). Good Paloma with fresh squeezed grapefruit juice.
author: P S.
